briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Construct a path with a start and end point.

detaileddescription.para: The delegate will be called when the path has been calculated. Do not confuse it with the Seeker callback as they are sent at different times. If you are using a Seeker to start the path you can set callback to null.

briefdescription.para: Calculate partial path if the target node cannot be reached.

detaileddescription.para:
If the target node cannot be reached, the node which was closest (given by heuristic) will be chosen as target node and a partial path will be returned. This only works if a heuristic is used (which is the default). If a partial path is found, CompleteState is set to Partial.
It is not required by other path types to respect this setting

briefdescription.para: Hints can be set to enable faster Get Nearest Node queries.

detaileddescription.para: Only applies to some graph types

briefdescription.para: End node of the path.
Exact end point of the path.
Target to use for H score calculations.
End Point exactly as in the path request.
Start Point exactly as in the path request.
Defines if start and end nodes will have their connection costs recalculated for this path.

detaileddescription.para:
These connection costs will be more accurate and based on the exact start point and target point, however it should not be used when connection costs are not the default ones (all build in graph generators currently generate default connection costs).
Int3.costMagnitude
Added in 3.0.8.3 Bug
Does not do anything in 3.2 and up due to incompabilities with multithreading. Will be enabled again in later versions.

briefdescription.para: Hints can be set to enable faster Get Nearest Node queries.

detaileddescription.para: Only applies to some graph types

briefdescription.para: Start point in integer coordinates.
Start node of the path.
Exact start point of the path.
Saved original costs for the end node.
Determines if a search for an end node should be done.

detaileddescription.para:
Set by different path types.
Added in 3.0.8.3

briefdescription.para: Current best target for the partial path.

detaileddescription.para: This is the node with the lowest H score

briefdescription.para: Create a new path with a start and end point.

detaileddescription.para: The delegate will be called when the path has been calculated. Do not confuse it with the Seeker callback as they are sent at different times. If you are using a Seeker to start the path you can set callbackDelegate to null

briefdescription.para: Calculates the path until completed or until the time has passed targetTick.

detaileddescription.para: Usually a check is only done every 500 nodes if the time has passed targetTick. Time/Ticks are got from System.DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks.

Basic outline of what the function does for the standard path (Pathfinding.ABPath). whiletheendhasnotbeenfoundandnoerrorhasocurred checkifwehavereachedtheend ifso,exitandreturnthepath
openthecurrentnode,i.eloopthroughitsneighbours,markthemasvisitedandputthemonaheap
checkiftherearestillnodeslefttoprocess(orhavewesearchedthewholegraph) iftherearenone,flagerrorandexit
popthenextnodeoftheheapandsetitascurrent
checkifthefunctionhasexceededthetimelimit ifso,returnandwaitforthefunctiontogetcalledagain

briefdescription.para: Returns a debug string for this path.
Returns in which direction to move from a point on the path.

detaileddescription.para:
A simple and quite slow (well, compared to more optimized algorithms) algorithm first finds the closest path segment (from vectorPath) and then returns the direction to the next point from there. The direction is not normalized.
Direction to move from a point, returns Vector3.zero if vectorPath is null or has a length of 0

briefdescription.para: Initializes the path.

detaileddescription.para: Sets up the open list and adds the first node to it

briefdescription.para: Prepares the path.

detaileddescription.para: Searches for start and end nodes and does some simple checking if a path is at all possible

briefdescription.para: Reset all values to their default values.

detaileddescription.para: All inheriting path types must implement this function, resetting ALL their variables to enable recycling of paths. Call this base function in inheriting types with base.Reset ();

briefdescription.para: Resets End Node Costs.

detaileddescription.para: Costs are updated on the end node at the start of the search to better reflect the end point passed to the path, the previous ones are saved in endNodeCosts and are reset in this function which is called after the path search is complete

briefdescription.para: Recycle the path.
Sets the start and end points.

detaileddescription.para: Sets originalStartPoint, originalEndPoint, startPoint, endPoint, startIntPoint and hTarget (to end )

briefdescription.para: Basic path, finds the shortest path from A to B.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the most basic path object it will try to find the shortest path from A to B. Many other path types inherit from this type.
Seeker.StartPath
